category: Member sport organization regulations/Article 24 (Duties of officers)
contents: Article 24 (Duties of Officers) ① The chairman represents the member sports organization and supervises its affairs, and is an unpaid, part-time honorary position. Revised April 25, 2018. ② The Vice Chairman assists the Chairman and performs the Chairman's duties when the Chairman is vacant or has difficulty performing his duties due to an accident. ③ Directors form the Board of Directors, attend the Board of Directors meetings, decide on matters related to their duties, and handle matters delegated by the Chairman and the Board of Directors. ④ The duties of the auditor are as follows. Revised 2017. 3. 23., 2019. 12. 20, 2021. 10. 6. 1. Auditing the financial status of member sports organizations 2. Auditing accounting for transparent execution of budgets such as subsidies of member sports organizations 3. Auditing the operation of the Board of Directors and its work 4. Reporting to the Board of Directors, general meeting, or sports association when illegal or improper matters are discovered regarding property status, budget execution, or business execution 5. Reporting under item 4. ⑤ If an executive of a member sports organization has been indicted for a crime related to the operation of the relevant organization, sports association, member organization, city/provincial sports association, or its member organization (hereinafter referred to as *Sports Association-related organization) In this case, his/her duties will be suspended. However, this does not apply in the following cases. Revised 2017. 3. 23., 2021. 10. 6. 1. When the only statutory penalty for the indicted crime is a fine 2. When a summary order is requested 3. When indicted as a negligent offender ⑥ An executive of a member sports organization If disciplinary proceedings are in progress due to an audit by the Sports Council for reasons of misconduct related to the operation of an organization, sports association, or sports association-related organization, the person's duties will be suspended. Revised March 23, 2017. ⑦ If an executive of a member sports organization is arrested for a crime other than the operation of the organization, his or her duties will be suspended. ⑧ If an executive of a city/provincial sports organization or a person representing a sports organization who has become an executive of a member sports organization is suspended from his/her duties in the relevant organization, his/her duties as an executive of the member sports organization will also naturally be suspended.
